text: - You're in charge

Every intelligence
agency reports to you.

Why not immediately
go to them and gather
evidence to support that?

PRESIDENT DONALD
TRUMP: Because I

don't want to do anything
that's going to violate
any strength of an agency.

You know, we have
enough problems.

And by the way, with the CIA,
I just want people to know,

the CIA was hacked and
a lot of things taken.
That was during the Obama years.
That was not during us.

That was during the
Obama situation.

Mike Pompeo is there now,
doing a fantastic job.

But we will be submitting
certain things.

And I will be perhaps
speaking about this next week.
- All right.
So that was last night.

You also just heard
there in that interview,

the president mentioned
that the CIA was hacked.

Well, moments ago,
the top Democrat

on the House Intelligence
Committee released a statement

and raised the question,
did did President Trump,

if this is proven true,
reveal classified information
during that interview?

Let's get over to CNN Senior
Congressional Reporter Manu
Raju with much more on this.

Adam Schiff just put out
this statement, Manu.
What is he getting at?

MANU RAJU: Well, he thinks that
he may have actually revealed
classified information.

If this is true-- now,
remember President
Trump said this last night.

"I just want people to
know, the CIA was hacked
and a lot of things taken.

That was during
the Obama years."

Now, Schiff is saying that in
his effort to blame President

Obama, President Trump may have
revealed classified information
that the CIA was hacked.

Now, Schiff is careful
in his statement

about saying whether or not
the CIA was actually hacked.

But his warning to
President Trump is this.

If you actually want to
declassify something,

it should be done in a
thoughtful manner-- not done

shooting off your head and just
saying something that could be

classified and something
that ordinarily would
be considered an illegal leak.
